017package org.apache.juneau.parser;
018
019import static org.apache.juneau.collections.JsonMap.*;
020import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.StringUtils.*;
021import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ClassUtils.*;
022
023import java.io.*;
024import java.lang.reflect.*;
025import java.nio.charset.*;
026import java.util.*;
027import java.util.function.*;
028
029import org.apache.juneau.*;
030import org.apache.juneau.annotation.*;
031import org.apache.juneau.collections.*;
032import org.apache.juneau.cp.*;
033import org.apache.juneau.httppart.*;
034import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
035import org.apache.juneau.objecttools.*;
036import org.apache.juneau.swap.*;
037
038/**
039 * Session object that lives for the duration of a single use of {@link Parser}.
040 *
041 * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
042 *    <li class='warn'>This class is not thread safe and is typically discarded after one use.
043 * </ul>
044 *
045 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
046 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/SerializersAndParsers">Serializers and Parsers</a>
047
048 * </ul>
049 */
050public class ParserSession extends BeanSession {
051
052   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
053   // Static
054   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
055
056   /**
057    * Creates a new builder for this object.
058    *
059    * @param ctx The context creating this session.
060    * @return A new builder.
061    */
062   public static Builder create(Parser ctx) {
063      return new Builder(ctx);
064   }
065
066   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
067   // Builder
068   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
069
070   /**
071    * Builder class.
072    */
073   public static class Builder extends BeanSession.Builder {
074
075      Parser ctx;
076      Method javaMethod;
077      Object outer;
078      HttpPartSchema schema;
079
080      /**
081       * Constructor
082       *
083       * @param ctx The context creating this session.
084       */
085      protected Builder(Parser ctx) {
086         super(ctx.getBeanContext());
087         this.ctx = ctx;
088         mediaTypeDefault(ctx.getPrimaryMediaType());
089      }
090
091      @Override
092      public ParserSession build() {
093         return new ParserSession(this);
094      }
095
096      /**
097       * The java method that called this serializer, usually the method in a REST servlet.
098       *
099       * @param value
100       *    The new property value.
101       *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
102       * @return This object.
103       */
104      public Builder javaMethod(Method value) {
105         this.javaMethod = value;
106         return this;
107      }
108
109      /**
110       * The outer object for instantiating top-level non-static inner classes.
111       *
112       * @param value
113       *    The new property value.
114       *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
115       * @return This object.
116       */
117      public Builder outer(Object value) {
118         this.outer = value;
119         return this;
120      }
121
122      /**
123       * HTTP-part schema.
124       *
125       * <p>
126       * Used for schema-based serializers and parsers to define additional formatting.
127       *
128       * @param value
129       *    The new value for this property.
130       *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
131       * @return This object.
132       */
133      public Builder schema(HttpPartSchema value) {
134         if (value != null)
135            this.schema = value;
136         return this;
137      }
138
139      /**
140       * Same as {@link #schema(HttpPartSchema)} but doesn't overwrite the value if it is already set.
141       *
142       * @param value
143       *    The new value for this property.
144       *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, then the locale defined on the context is used.
145       * @return This object.
146       */
147      public Builder schemaDefault(HttpPartSchema value) {
148         if (value != null && schema == null)
149            this.schema = value;
150         return this;
151      }
152      @Override /* Overridden from Builder */
153      public <T> Builder apply(Class<T> type, Consumer<T> apply) {
154         super.apply(type, apply);
155         return this;
156      }
157
158      @Override /* Overridden from Builder */
159      public Builder debug(Boolean value) {
160         super.debug(value);
161         return this;
162      }
163
164      @Override /* Overridden from Builder */
165      public Builder properties(Map<String,Object> value) {
166         super.properties(value);
167         return this;
168      }
169
170      @Override /* Overridden from Builder */
171      public Builder property(String key, Object value) {
172         super.property(key, value);
173         return this;
174      }
175
176      @Override /* Overridden from Builder */
177      public Builder unmodifiable() {
178         super.unmodifiable();
179         return this;
180      }
181
182      @Override /* Overridden from Builder */
183      public Builder locale(Locale value) {
184         super.locale(value);
185         return this;
186      }
187
188      @Override /* Overridden from Builder */
189      public Builder localeDefault(Locale value) {
190         super.localeDefault(value);
191         return this;
192      }
193
194      @Override /* Overridden from Builder */
195      public Builder mediaType(MediaType value) {
196         super.mediaType(value);
197         return this;
198      }
199
200      @Override /* Overridden from Builder */
201      public Builder mediaTypeDefault(MediaType value) {
202         super.mediaTypeDefault(value);
203         return this;
204      }
205
206      @Override /* Overridden from Builder */
207      public Builder timeZone(TimeZone value) {
208         super.timeZone(value);
209         return this;
210      }
211
212      @Override /* Overridden from Builder */
213      public Builder timeZoneDefault(TimeZone value) {
214         super.timeZoneDefault(value);
215         return this;
216      }
217   }
218
219   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
220   // Instance
221   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
222
223   private final Parser ctx;
224   private final Method javaMethod;
225   private final Object outer;
226   private final Stack<StringBuilder> sbStack;
227   private final HttpPartSchema schema;
228
229   // Writable properties.
230   private BeanPropertyMeta currentProperty;
231   private ClassMeta<?> currentClass;
232   private final ParserListener listener;
233
234   private Position mark = new Position(-1);
235
236   private ParserPipe pipe;
237
238   /**
239    * Constructor.
240    *
241    * @param builder The builder for this object.
242    */
243   protected ParserSession(Builder builder) {
244      super(builder);
245      ctx = builder.ctx;
246      javaMethod = builder.javaMethod;
247      outer = builder.outer;
248      schema = builder.schema;
249      listener = BeanCreator.of(ParserListener.class).type(ctx.getListener()).orElse(null);
250      sbStack = new Stack<>();
251   }
252
253   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
254   // Abstract methods
255   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
256
257   /**
258    * Workhorse method.
259    *
260    * <p>
261    * Subclasses are expected to implement this method or {@link Parser#doParse(ParserSession,ParserPipe,ClassMeta)}.
262    *
263    * <p>
264    * The default implementation of this method simply calls {@link Parser#doParse(ParserSession,ParserPipe,ClassMeta)}.
265    *
266    * @param pipe Where to get the input from.
267    * @param type
268    *    The class type of the object to create.
269    *    If <jk>null</jk> or <code>Object.<jk>class</jk></code>, object type is based on what's being parsed.
270    *    For example, when parsing JSON text, it may return a <c>String</c>, <c>Number</c>,
271    *    <c>JsonMap</c>, etc...
272    * @param <T> The class type of the object to create.
273    * @return The parsed object.
274    * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
275    * @throws ParseException Malformed input encountered.
276    * @throws ExecutableException Exception occurred on invoked constructor/method/field.
277    */
278   protected <T> T doParse(ParserPipe pipe, ClassMeta<T> type) throws IOException, ParseException, ExecutableException {
279      return ctx.doParse(this, pipe, type);
280   }
281
282   /**
283    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this parser subclasses from {@link ReaderParser}.
284    *
285    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this parser subclasses from {@link ReaderParser}.
286    */
287   public boolean isReaderParser() {
288      return false;
289   }
290
291   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
292   // Other methods
293   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
294
295   /**
296    * Wraps the specified input object into a {@link ParserPipe} object so that it can be easily converted into
297    * a stream or reader.
298    *
299    * @param input
300    *    The input.
301    *    <br>For character-based parsers, this can be any of the following types:
302    *    <ul>
303    *       <li><jk>null</jk>
304    *       <li>{@link Reader}
305    *       <li>{@link CharSequence}
306    *       <li>{@link InputStream} containing UTF-8 encoded text (or whatever the encoding specified by
307    *          {@link ReaderParser.Builder#streamCharset(Charset)}).
308    *       <li><code><jk>byte</jk>[]</code> containing UTF-8 encoded text (or whatever the encoding specified by
309    *          {@link ReaderParser.Builder#streamCharset(Charset)}).
310    *       <li>{@link File} containing system encoded text (or whatever the encoding specified by
311    *          {@link ReaderParser.Builder#fileCharset(Charset)}).
312    *    </ul>
313    *    <br>For byte-based parsers, this can be any of the following types:
314    *    <ul>
315    *       <li><jk>null</jk>
316    *       <li>{@link InputStream}
317    *       <li><code><jk>byte</jk>[]</code>
318    *       <li>{@link File}
319    *       <li>{@link CharSequence} containing encoded bytes according to the {@link InputStreamParser.Builder#binaryFormat(BinaryFormat)} setting.
320    *    </ul>
321    * @return
322    *    A new {@link ParserPipe} wrapper around the specified input object.
323    */
324   protected ParserPipe createPipe(Object input) {
325      return null;
326   }
327
328   /**
329    * Returns information used to determine at what location in the parse a failure occurred.
330    *
331    * @return A map, typically containing something like <c>{line:123,column:456,currentProperty:"foobar"}</c>
332    */
333   public final JsonMap getLastLocation() {
334      JsonMap m = new JsonMap();
335      if (currentClass != null)
336         m.put("currentClass", currentClass.toString(true));
337      if (currentProperty != null)
338         m.put("currentProperty", currentProperty);
339      return m;
340   }
341
342   /**
343    * Returns the Java method that invoked this parser.
344    *
345    * <p>
346    * When using the REST API, this is the Java method invoked by the REST call.
347    * Can be used to access annotations defined on the method or class.
348    *
349    * @return The Java method that invoked this parser.
350   */
351   protected final Method getJavaMethod() {
352      return javaMethod;
353   }
354
355   /**
356    * Returns the outer object used for instantiating top-level non-static member classes.
357    *
358    * <p>
359    * When using the REST API, this is the servlet object.
360    *
361    * @return The outer object.
362   */
363   protected final Object getOuter() {
364      return outer;
365   }
366
367   /**
368    * Sets the current bean property being parsed for proper error messages.
369    *
370    * @param currentProperty The current property being parsed.
371    */
372   protected final void setCurrentProperty(BeanPropertyMeta currentProperty) {
373      this.currentProperty = currentProperty;
374   }
375
376   /**
377    * Sets the current class being parsed for proper error messages.
378    *
379    * @param currentClass The current class being parsed.
380    */
381   protected final void setCurrentClass(ClassMeta<?> currentClass) {
382      this.currentClass = currentClass;
383   }
384
385   /**
386    * Trims the specified object if it's a <c>String</c> and {@link #isTrimStrings()} returns <jk>true</jk>.
387    *
388    * @param <K> The object type.
389    * @param o The object to trim.
390    * @return The trimmed string if it's a string.
391    */
392   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
393   protected final <K> K trim(K o) {
394      if (isTrimStrings() && o instanceof String)
395         return (K)o.toString().trim();
396      return o;
397
398   }
399
400   /**
401    * Trims the specified string if {@link ParserSession#isTrimStrings()} returns <jk>true</jk>.
402    *
403    * @param s The input string to trim.
404    * @return The trimmed string, or <jk>null</jk> if the input was <jk>null</jk>.
405    */
406   protected final String trim(String s) {
407      if (isTrimStrings() && s != null)
408         return s.trim();
409      return s;
410   }
411
412   /**
413    * Converts the specified <c>JsonMap</c> into a bean identified by the <js>"_type"</js> property in the map.
414    *
415    * @param m The map to convert to a bean.
416    * @param pMeta The current bean property being parsed.
417    * @param eType The current expected type being parsed.
418    * @return
419    *    The converted bean, or the same map if the <js>"_type"</js> entry wasn't found or didn't resolve to a bean.
420    */
421   protected final Object cast(JsonMap m, BeanPropertyMeta pMeta, ClassMeta<?> eType) {
422
423      String btpn = getBeanTypePropertyName(eType);
424
425      Object o = m.get(btpn);
426      if (o == null)
427         return m;
428      String typeName = o.toString();
429
430      ClassMeta<?> cm = getClassMeta(typeName, pMeta, eType);
431
432      if (cm != null) {
433         BeanMap<?> bm = m.getBeanSession().newBeanMap(cm.getInnerClass());
434
435         // Iterate through all the entries in the map and set the individual field values.
436         m.forEach((k,v) -> {
437            if (! k.equals(btpn)) {
438               // Attempt to recursively cast child maps.
439               if (v instanceof JsonMap)
440                  v = cast((JsonMap)v, pMeta, eType);
441               bm.put(k, v);
442            }
443         });
444         return bm.getBean();
445      }
446
447      return m;
448   }
449
450   /**
451    * Give the specified dictionary name, resolve it to a class.
452    *
453    * @param typeName The dictionary name to resolve.
454    * @param pMeta The bean property we're currently parsing.
455    * @param eType The expected type we're currently parsing.
456    * @return The resolved class, or <jk>null</jk> if the type name could not be resolved.
457    */
458   protected final ClassMeta<?> getClassMeta(String typeName, BeanPropertyMeta pMeta, ClassMeta<?> eType) {
459      BeanRegistry br = null;
460
461      // Resolve via @Beanp(dictionary={})
462      if (pMeta != null) {
463         br = pMeta.getBeanRegistry();
464         if (br != null && br.hasName(typeName))
465            return br.getClassMeta(typeName);
466      }
467
468      // Resolve via @Bean(dictionary={}) on the expected type where the
469      // expected type is an interface with subclasses.
470      if (eType != null) {
471         br = eType.getBeanRegistry();
472         if (br != null && br.hasName(typeName))
473            return br.getClassMeta(typeName);
474      }
475
476      // Last resort, resolve using the session registry.
477      return getBeanRegistry().getClassMeta(typeName);
478   }
479
480   /**
481    * Specialized warning when an exception is thrown while executing a bean setter.
482    *
483    * @param p The bean map entry representing the bean property.
484    * @param t The throwable that the bean setter threw.
485    */
486   protected final void onBeanSetterException(BeanPropertyMeta p, Throwable t) {
487      if (listener != null)
488         listener.onBeanSetterException(this, t, p);
489      String prefix = "";
490      addWarning("{0}Could not call setValue() on property ''{1}'' of class ''{2}'', exception = {3}", prefix,
491         p.getName(), p.getBeanMeta().getClassMeta(), t.getLocalizedMessage());
492   }
493
494   /**
495    * Method that gets called when an unknown bean property name is encountered.
496    *
497    * @param propertyName The unknown bean property name.
498    * @param beanMap The bean that doesn't have the expected property.
499    * @param value The parsed value.
500    * @throws ParseException
501    *    Automatically thrown if {@link org.apache.juneau.BeanContext.Builder#ignoreUnknownBeanProperties()} setting on this parser is
502    *    <jk>false</jk>
503    * @param <T> The class type of the bean map that doesn't have the expected property.
504    */
505   protected final <T> void onUnknownProperty(String propertyName, BeanMap<T> beanMap, Object value) throws ParseException {
506      if (propertyName.equals(getBeanTypePropertyName(beanMap.getClassMeta())))
507         return;
508      if (! isIgnoreUnknownBeanProperties())
509         if (value != null || ! isIgnoreUnknownNullBeanProperties())
510            throw new ParseException(this,
511               "Unknown property ''{0}'' encountered while trying to parse into class ''{1}''", propertyName,
512               beanMap.getClassMeta());
513      if (listener != null)
514         listener.onUnknownBeanProperty(this, propertyName, beanMap.getClassMeta().getInnerClass(), beanMap.getBean());
515   }
516
517   /**
518    * Parses input into the specified object type.
519    *
520    * <p>
521    * The type can be a simple type (e.g. beans, strings, numbers) or parameterized type (collections/maps).
522    *
523    * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
524    * <p class='bjava'>
525    *    ReaderParser <jv>parser</jv> = JsonParser.<jsf>DEFAULT</jsf>;
526    *
527    *    <jc>// Parse into a linked-list of strings.</jc>
528    *    List <jv>list1</jv> = <jv>parser</jv>.parse(<jv>json</jv>, LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);
529    *
530    *    <jc>// Parse into a linked-list of beans.</jc>
531    *    List <jv>list2</jv> = <jv>parser</jv>.parse(<jv>json</jv>, LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
532    *
533    *    <jc>// Parse into a linked-list of linked-lists of strings.</jc>
534    *    List <jv>list3</jv> = <jv>parser</jv>.parse(<jv>json</jv>, LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);
535    *
536    *    <jc>// Parse into a map of string keys/values.</jc>
537    *    Map <jv>map1</jv> = <jv>parser</jv>.parse(<jv>json</jv>, TreeMap.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);
538    *
539    *    <jc>// Parse into a map containing string keys and values of lists containing beans.</jc>
540    *    Map <jv>map2</jv> = <jv>parser</jv>.parse(<jv>json</jv>, TreeMap.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>, List.<jk>class</jk>, MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
541    * </p>
542    *
543    * <p>
544    * <c>Collection</c> classes are assumed to be followed by zero or one objects indicating the element type.
545    *
546    * <p>
547    * <c>Map</c> classes are assumed to be followed by zero or two meta objects indicating the key and value types.
548    *
549    * <p>
550    * The array can be arbitrarily long to indicate arbitrarily complex data structures.
551    *
552    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
553    *    <li class='note'>
554    *       Use the {@link #parse(Object, Class)} method instead if you don't need a parameterized map/collection.
555    * </ul>
556    *
557    * @param <T> The class type of the object to create.
558    * @param input
559    *    The input.
560    *    <br>Character-based parsers can handle the following input class types:
561    *    <ul>
562    *       <li><jk>null</jk>
563    *       <li>{@link Reader}
564    *       <li>{@link CharSequence}
565    *       <li>{@link InputStream} containing UTF-8 encoded text (or charset defined by
566    *          {@link ReaderParser.Builder#streamCharset(Charset)} property value).
567    *       <li><code><jk>byte</jk>[]</code> containing UTF-8 encoded text (or charset defined by
568    *          {@link ReaderParser.Builder#streamCharset(Charset)} property value).
569    *       <li>{@link File} containing system encoded text (or charset defined by
570    *          {@link ReaderParser.Builder#fileCharset(Charset)} property value).
571    *    </ul>
572    *    <br>Stream-based parsers can handle the following input class types:
573    *    <ul>
574    *       <li><jk>null</jk>
575    *       <li>{@link InputStream}
576    *       <li><code><jk>byte</jk>[]</code>
577    *       <li>{@link File}
578    *    </ul>
579    * @param type
580    *    The object type to create.
581    *    <br>Can be any of the following: {@link ClassMeta}, {@link Class}, {@link ParameterizedType}, {@link GenericArrayType}
582    * @param args
583    *    The type arguments of the class if it's a collection or map.
584    *    <br>Can be any of the following: {@link ClassMeta}, {@link Class}, {@link ParameterizedType}, {@link GenericArrayType}
585    *    <br>Ignored if the main type is not a map or collection.
586    * @return The parsed object.
587    * @throws ParseException Malformed input encountered.
588    * @see BeanSession#getClassMeta(Type,Type...) for argument syntax for maps and collections.
589    * @throws IOException Thrown by the underlying stream.
590    */
591   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
592   public final <T> T parse(Object input, Type type, Type...args) throws ParseException, IOException {
593      try (ParserPipe pipe = createPipe(input)) {
594         return (T)parseInner(pipe, getClassMeta(type, args));
595      }
596   }
597
598   /**
599    * Same as {@link #parse(Object,Type,Type...)} but parses from a string and doesn't throw an {@link IOException}.
600    *
601    * @param <T> The class type of the object to create.
602    * @param input
603    *    The input.
604    *    <br>Character-based parsers can handle the following input class types:
605    *    <ul>
606    *       <li><jk>null</jk>
607    *       <li>{@link Reader}
608    *       <li>{@link CharSequence}
609    *       <li>{@link InputStream} containing UTF-8 encoded text (or charset defined by
610    *          {@link ReaderParser.Builder#streamCharset(Charset)} property value).
611    *       <li><code><jk>byte</jk>[]</code> containing UTF-8 encoded text (or charset defined by
612    *          {@link ReaderParser.Builder#streamCharset(Charset)} property value).
613    *       <li>{@link File} containing system encoded text (or charset defined by
614    *          {@link ReaderParser.Builder#fileCharset(Charset)} property value).
615    *    </ul>
616    *    <br>Stream-based parsers can handle the following input class types:
617    *    <ul>
618    *       <li><jk>null</jk>
619    *       <li>{@link InputStream}
620    *       <li><code><jk>byte</jk>[]</code>
621    *       <li>{@link File}
622    *    </ul>
623    * @param type
624    *    The object type to create.
625    *    <br>Can be any of the following: {@link ClassMeta}, {@link Class}, {@link ParameterizedType}, {@link GenericArrayType}
626    * @param args
627    *    The type arguments of the class if it's a collection or map.
628    *    <br>Can be any of the following: {@link ClassMeta}, {@link Class}, {@link ParameterizedType}, {@link GenericArrayType}
629    *    <br>Ignored if the main type is not a map or collection.
630    * @return The parsed object.
631    * @throws ParseException Malformed input encountered.
632    * @see BeanSession#getClassMeta(Type,Type...) for argument syntax for maps and collections.
633    */
634   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
635   public final <T> T parse(String input, Type type, Type...args) throws ParseException {
636      try (ParserPipe pipe = createPipe(input)) {
637         return (T)parseInner(pipe, getClassMeta(type, args));
638      } catch (IOException e) {
639         throw new ParseException(e); // Shouldn't happen.
640      }
641   }
642
643   /**
644    * Same as {@link #parse(Object, Type, Type...)} except optimized for a non-parameterized class.
645    *
646    * <p>
647    * This is the preferred parse method for simple types since you don't need to cast the results.
648    *
649    * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
650    * <p class='bjava'>
651    *    ReaderParser <jv>parser</jv> = JsonParser.<jsf>DEFAULT</jsf>;
652    *
653    *    <jc>// Parse into a string.</jc>
654    *    String <jv>string</jv> = <jv>parser</jv>.parse(<jv>json</jv>, String.<jk>class</jk>);
655    *
656    *    <jc>// Parse into a bean.</jc>
657    *    MyBean <jv>bean</jv> = <jv>parser</jv>.parse(<jv>json</jv>, MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
658    *
659    *    <jc>// Parse into a bean array.</jc>
660    *    MyBean[] <jv>beanArray</jv> = <jv>parser</jv>.parse(<jv>json</jv>, MyBean[].<jk>class</jk>);
661    *
662    *    <jc>// Parse into a linked-list of objects.</jc>
663    *    List <jv>list</jv> = <jv>parser</jv>.parse(<jv>json</jv>, LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>);
664    *
665    *    <jc>// Parse into a map of object keys/values.</jc>
666    *    Map <jv>map</jv> = <jv>parser</jv>.parse(<jv>json</jv>, TreeMap.<jk>class</jk>);
667    * </p>
668    *
669    * @param <T> The class type of the object being created.
670    * @param input
671    *    The input.
672    *    See {@link #parse(Object, Type, Type...)} for details.
673    * @param type The object type to create.
674    * @return The parsed object.
675    * @throws ParseException Malformed input encountered.
676    * @throws IOException Thrown by the underlying stream.
677    */
678   public final <T> T parse(Object input, Class<T> type) throws ParseException, IOException {
679      try (ParserPipe pipe = createPipe(input)) {
680         return parseInner(pipe, getClassMeta(type));
681      }
682   }
683
684   /**
685    * Same as {@link #parse(Object, Class)} but parses from a string and doesn't throw an {@link IOException}.
686    *
687    * <p>
688    * This is the preferred parse method for simple types since you don't need to cast the results.
689    *
690    * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
691    * <p class='bjava'>
692    *    ReaderParser <jv>parser</jv> = JsonParser.<jsf>DEFAULT</jsf>;
693    *
694    *    <jc>// Parse into a string.</jc>
695    *    String <jv>string</jv> = <jv>parser</jv>.parse(<jv>json</jv>, String.<jk>class</jk>);
696    *
697    *    <jc>// Parse into a bean.</jc>
698    *    MyBean <jv>bean</jv> = <jv>parser</jv>.parse(<jv>json</jv>, MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
699    *
700    *    <jc>// Parse into a bean array.</jc>
701    *    MyBean[] <jv>beanArray</jv> = <jv>parser</jv>.parse(<jv>json</jv>, MyBean[].<jk>class</jk>);
702    *
703    *    <jc>// Parse into a linked-list of objects.</jc>
704    *    List <jv>list</jv> = <jv>parser</jv>.parse(<jv>json</jv>, LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>);
705    *
706    *    <jc>// Parse into a map of object keys/values.</jc>
707    *    Map <jv>map</jv> = <jv>parser</jv>.parse(<jv>json</jv>, TreeMap.<jk>class</jk>);
708    * </p>
709    *
710    * @param <T> The class type of the object being created.
711    * @param input
712    *    The input.
713    *    See {@link #parse(Object, Type, Type...)} for details.
714    * @param type The object type to create.
715    * @return The parsed object.
716    * @throws ParseException Malformed input encountered.
717    */
718   public final <T> T parse(String input, Class<T> type) throws ParseException {
719      try (ParserPipe pipe = createPipe(input)) {
720         return parseInner(pipe, getClassMeta(type));
721      } catch (IOException e) {
722         throw new ParseException(e); // Shouldn't happen.
723      }
724   }
725
726   /**
727    * Same as {@link #parse(Object, Type, Type...)} except the type has already been converted into a {@link ClassMeta}
728    * object.
729    *
730    * <p>
731    * This is mostly an internal method used by the framework.
732    *
733    * @param <T> The class type of the object being created.
734    * @param input
735    *    The input.
736    *    See {@link #parse(Object, Type, Type...)} for details.
737    * @param type The object type to create.
738    * @return The parsed object.
739    * @throws ParseException Malformed input encountered.
740    * @throws IOException Thrown by the underlying stream.
741    */
742   public final <T> T parse(Object input, ClassMeta<T> type) throws ParseException, IOException {
743      try (ParserPipe pipe = createPipe(input)) {
744         return parseInner(pipe, type);
745      }
746   }
747
748   /**
749    * Same as {@link #parse(Object, ClassMeta)} except parses from a string and doesn't throw an {@link IOException}.
750    *
751    * <p>
752    * This is mostly an internal method used by the framework.
753    *
754    * @param <T> The class type of the object being created.
755    * @param input
756    *    The input.
757    *    See {@link #parse(Object, Type, Type...)} for details.
758    * @param type The object type to create.
759    * @return The parsed object.
760    * @throws ParseException Malformed input encountered.
761    */
762   public final <T> T parse(String input, ClassMeta<T> type) throws ParseException {
763      try (ParserPipe pipe = createPipe(input)) {
764         return parseInner(pipe, type);
765      } catch (IOException e) {
766         throw new ParseException(e); // Shouldn't happen.
767      }
768   }
769
770   /**
771    * Entry point for all parsing calls.
772    *
773    * <p>
774    * Calls the {@link #doParse(ParserPipe, ClassMeta)} implementation class and catches/re-wraps any exceptions
775    * thrown.
776    *
777    * @param pipe The parser input.
778    * @param type The class type of the object to create.
779    * @param <T> The class type of the object to create.
780    * @return The parsed object.
781    * @throws ParseException Malformed input encountered.
782    * @throws IOException Thrown by the underlying stream.
783    */
784   private <T> T parseInner(ParserPipe pipe, ClassMeta<T> type) throws ParseException, IOException {
785      if (type.isVoid())
786         return null;
787      try {
788         return doParse(pipe, type);
789      } catch (ParseException | IOException e) {
790         throw e;
791      } catch (StackOverflowError e) {
792         throw new ParseException(this, "Depth too deep.  Stack overflow occurred.");
793      } catch (Exception e) {
794         throw new ParseException(this, e, "Exception occurred.  exception={0}, message={1}.",
795            e.getClass().getSimpleName(), e.getLocalizedMessage());
796      } finally {
797         checkForWarnings();
798      }
799   }
800
801   /**
802    * Parses the contents of the specified reader and loads the results into the specified map.
803    *
804    * <p>
805    * Reader must contain something that serializes to a map (such as text containing a JSON object).
806    *
807    * <p>
808    * Used in the following locations:
809    * <ul class='spaced-list'>
810    *    <li>
811    *       The various character-based constructors in {@link JsonMap} (e.g.
812    *       {@link JsonMap#JsonMap(CharSequence,Parser)}).
813    * </ul>
814    *
815    * @param <K> The key class type.
816    * @param <V> The value class type.
817    * @param input The input.  See {@link #parse(Object, ClassMeta)} for supported input types.
818    * @param m The map being loaded.
819    * @param keyType The class type of the keys, or <jk>null</jk> to default to <code>String.<jk>class</jk></code>.
820    * @param valueType The class type of the values, or <jk>null</jk> to default to whatever is being parsed.
821    * @return The same map that was passed in to allow this method to be chained.
822    * @throws ParseException Malformed input encountered.
823    * @throws UnsupportedOperationException If not implemented.
824    */
825   public final <K,V> Map<K,V> parseIntoMap(Object input, Map<K,V> m, Type keyType, Type valueType) throws ParseException {
826      try (ParserPipe pipe = createPipe(input)) {
827         return doParseIntoMap(pipe, m, keyType, valueType);
828      } catch (ParseException e) {
829         throw e;
830      } catch (Exception e) {
831         throw new ParseException(this, e);
832      } finally {
833         checkForWarnings();
834      }
835   }
836
837   /**
838    * Implementation method.
839    *
840    * <p>
841    * Default implementation throws an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}.
842    *
843    * @param <K> The key type.
844    * @param <V> The value type.
845    * @param pipe The parser input.
846    * @param m The map being loaded.
847    * @param keyType The class type of the keys, or <jk>null</jk> to default to <code>String.<jk>class</jk></code>.
848    * @param valueType The class type of the values, or <jk>null</jk> to default to whatever is being parsed.
849    * @return The same map that was passed in to allow this method to be chained.
850    * @throws Exception If thrown from underlying stream, or if the input contains a syntax error or is malformed.
851    */
852   protected <K,V> Map<K,V> doParseIntoMap(ParserPipe pipe, Map<K,V> m, Type keyType, Type valueType) throws Exception {
853      throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Parser '"+className(getClass())+"' does not support this method.");
854   }
855
856   /**
857    * Parses the contents of the specified reader and loads the results into the specified collection.
858    *
859    * <p>
860    * Used in the following locations:
861    * <ul class='spaced-list'>
862    *    <li>
863    *       The various character-based constructors in {@link JsonList} (e.g.
864    *       {@link JsonList#JsonList(CharSequence,Parser)}.
865    * </ul>
866    *
867    * @param <E> The element class type.
868    * @param input The input.  See {@link #parse(Object, ClassMeta)} for supported input types.
869    * @param c The collection being loaded.
870    * @param elementType The class type of the elements, or <jk>null</jk> to default to whatever is being parsed.
871    * @return The same collection that was passed in to allow this method to be chained.
872    * @throws ParseException Malformed input encountered.
873    * @throws UnsupportedOperationException If not implemented.
874    */
875   public final <E> Collection<E> parseIntoCollection(Object input, Collection<E> c, Type elementType) throws ParseException {
876      try (ParserPipe pipe = createPipe(input)) {
877         return doParseIntoCollection(pipe, c, elementType);
878      } catch (ParseException e) {
879         throw e;
880      } catch (StackOverflowError e) {
881         throw new ParseException(this, "Depth too deep.  Stack overflow occurred.");
882      } catch (IOException e) {
883         throw new ParseException(this, e, "I/O exception occurred.  exception={0}, message={1}.",
884            e.getClass().getSimpleName(), e.getLocalizedMessage());
885      } catch (Exception e) {
886         throw new ParseException(this, e, "Exception occurred.  exception={0}, message={1}.",
887            e.getClass().getSimpleName(), e.getLocalizedMessage());
888      } finally {
889         checkForWarnings();
890      }
891   }
892
893   /**
894    * Implementation method.
895    *
896    * <p>
897    * Default implementation throws an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}.
898    *
899    * @param <E> The element type.
900    * @param pipe The parser input.
901    * @param c The collection being loaded.
902    * @param elementType The class type of the elements, or <jk>null</jk> to default to whatever is being parsed.
903    * @return The same collection that was passed in to allow this method to be chained.
904    * @throws Exception If thrown from underlying stream, or if the input contains a syntax error or is malformed.
905    */
906   protected <E> Collection<E> doParseIntoCollection(ParserPipe pipe, Collection<E> c, Type elementType) throws Exception {
907      throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Parser '"+className(getClass())+"' does not support this method.");
908   }
909
910   /**
911    * Parses the specified array input with each entry in the object defined by the {@code argTypes}
912    * argument.
913    *
914    * <p>
915    * Used for converting arrays (e.g. <js>"[arg1,arg2,...]"</js>) into an {@code Object[]} that can be passed
916    * to the {@code Method.invoke(target, args)} method.
917    *
918    * <p>
919    * Used in the following locations:
920    * <ul class='spaced-list'>
921    *    <li>
922    *       Used to parse argument strings in the {@link ObjectIntrospector#invokeMethod(Method, Reader)} method.
923    * </ul>
924    *
925    * @param input The input.  Subclasses can support different input types.
926    * @param argTypes Specifies the type of objects to create for each entry in the array.
927    * @return An array of parsed objects.
928    * @throws ParseException Malformed input encountered.
929    */
930   public final Object[] parseArgs(Object input, Type[] argTypes) throws ParseException {
931      try (ParserPipe pipe = createPipe(input)) {
932         return doParse(pipe, getArgsClassMeta(argTypes));
933      } catch (ParseException e) {
934         throw e;
935      } catch (StackOverflowError e) {
936         throw new ParseException(this, "Depth too deep.  Stack overflow occurred.");
937      } catch (IOException e) {
938         throw new ParseException(this, e, "I/O exception occurred.  exception={0}, message={1}.",
939            e.getClass().getSimpleName(), e.getLocalizedMessage());
940      } catch (Exception e) {
941         throw new ParseException(this, e, "Exception occurred.  exception={0}, message={1}.",
942            e.getClass().getSimpleName(), e.getLocalizedMessage());
943      } finally {
944         checkForWarnings();
945      }
946   }
947
948   /**
949    * Converts the specified string to the specified type.
950    *
951    * @param outer
952    *    The outer object if we're converting to an inner object that needs to be created within the context
953    *    of an outer object.
954    * @param s The string to convert.
955    * @param type The class type to convert the string to.
956    * @return The string converted as an object of the specified type.
957    * @param <T> The class type to convert the string to.
958    * @throws ParseException Malformed input encountered.
959    * @throws ExecutableException Exception occurred on invoked constructor/method/field.
960    */
961   @SuppressWarnings({ "unchecked", "rawtypes" })
962   protected final <T> T convertAttrToType(Object outer, String s, ClassMeta<T> type) throws ParseException {
963      if (s == null)
964         return null;
965
966      if (type == null)
967         type = (ClassMeta<T>)object();
968      ObjectSwap swap = type.getSwap(this);
969      ClassMeta<?> sType = swap == null ? type : swap.getSwapClassMeta(this);
970
971      Object o = s;
972      if (sType.isChar())
973         o = parseCharacter(s);
974      else if (sType.isNumber())
975         o = parseNumber(s, (Class<? extends Number>)sType.getInnerClass());
976      else if (sType.isBoolean())
977         o = Boolean.parseBoolean(s);
978      else if (! (sType.isCharSequence() || sType.isObject())) {
979         if (sType.canCreateNewInstanceFromString(outer))
980            o = sType.newInstanceFromString(outer, s);
981         else
982            throw new ParseException(this, "Invalid conversion from string to class ''{0}''", type);
983      }
984
985      if (swap != null)
986         o = unswap(swap, o, type);
987
988      return (T)o;
989   }
990
991   /**
992    * Convenience method for calling the {@link ParentProperty @ParentProperty} method on the specified object if it
993    * exists.
994    *
995    * @param cm The class type of the object.
996    * @param o The object.
997    * @param parent The parent to set.
998    * @throws ExecutableException Exception occurred on invoked constructor/method/field.
999    */
1000   protected static final void setParent(ClassMeta<?> cm, Object o, Object parent) throws ExecutableException {
1001      Setter m = cm.getParentProperty();
1002      if (m != null)
1003         m.set(o, parent);
1004   }
1005
1006   /**
1007    * Convenience method for calling the {@link NameProperty @NameProperty} method on the specified object if it exists.
1008    *
1009    * @param cm The class type of the object.
1010    * @param o The object.
1011    * @param name The name to set.
1012    * @throws ExecutableException Exception occurred on invoked constructor/method/field.
1013    */
1014   protected static final void setName(ClassMeta<?> cm, Object o, Object name) throws ExecutableException {
1015      if (cm != null) {
1016         Setter m = cm.getNameProperty();
1017         if (m != null)
1018            m.set(o, name);
1019      }
1020   }
1021
1022   /**
1023    * Returns the listener associated with this session.
1024    *
1025    * @param <T> The listener type.
1026    * @param c The listener class to cast to.
1027    * @return The listener associated with this session, or <jk>null</jk> if there is no listener.
1028    */
1029   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1030   public <T extends ParserListener> T getListener(Class<T> c) {
1031      return (T)listener;
1032   }
1033
1034   /**
1035    * The {@link #createPipe(Object)} method should call this method to set the pipe for debugging purposes.
1036    *
1037    * @param pipe The pipe created for this session.
1038    * @return The same pipe.
1039    */
1040   protected ParserPipe setPipe(ParserPipe pipe) {
1041      this.pipe = pipe;
1042      return pipe;
1043   }
1044
1045   /**
1046    * Returns the current position into the reader or input stream.
1047    *
1048    * @return
1049    *    The current position into the reader or input stream.
1050    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
1051    */
1052   public Position getPosition() {
1053      if (mark.line != -1 || mark.column != -1 || mark.position != -1)
1054         return mark;
1055      if (pipe == null)
1056         return Position.UNKNOWN;
1057      return pipe.getPosition();
1058   }
1059
1060   /**
1061    * Marks the current position.
1062    */
1063   protected void mark() {
1064      if (pipe != null) {
1065         Position p = pipe.getPosition();
1066         mark.line = p.line;
1067         mark.column = p.column;
1068         mark.position = p.position;
1069      }
1070   }
1071
1072   /**
1073    * Unmarks the current position.
1074    */
1075   protected void unmark() {
1076      mark.line = -1;
1077      mark.column = -1;
1078      mark.position = -1;
1079   }
1080
1081   /**
1082    * Returns the input as a string.
1083    *
1084    * <p>
1085    * This always returns a value for input of type {@link CharSequence}.
1086    * <br>For other input types, use {@link org.apache.juneau.Context.Builder#debug()} setting to enable caching to a string
1087    * before parsing so that this method returns the input.
1088    *
1089    * @return The input as a string, or <jk>null</jk> if no pipe has been created or we're reading from an uncached reader or input stream source.
1090    */
1091   public String getInputAsString() {
1092      return pipe == null ? null : pipe.getInputAsString();
1093   }
1094
1095   /**
1096    * Invokes the specified swap on the specified object.
1097    *
1098    * @param swap The swap to invoke.
1099    * @param o The input object.
1100    * @param eType The expected type.
1101    * @return The swapped object.
1102    * @throws ParseException If swap method threw an exception.
1103    */
1104   @SuppressWarnings({ "rawtypes", "unchecked" })
1105   protected Object unswap(ObjectSwap swap, Object o, ClassMeta<?> eType) throws ParseException {
1106      try {
1107         return swap.unswap(this, o, eType);
1108      } catch (Exception e) {
1109         throw new ParseException(e);
1110      }
1111   }
1112
1113   /**
1114    * Creates a reusable {@link StringBuilder} object from an internal pool.
1115    *
1116    * <p>
1117    * String builders are returned to the pool by calling {@link #returnStringBuilder(StringBuilder)}.
1118    *
1119    * @return A new or previously returned string builder.
1120    */
1121   protected final StringBuilder getStringBuilder() {
1122      if (sbStack.isEmpty())
1123         return new StringBuilder();
1124      return sbStack.pop();
1125   }
1126
1127   /**
1128    * Returns a {@link StringBuilder} object back into the internal reuse pool.
1129    *
1130    * @param sb The string builder to return to the pool.  No-op if <jk>null</jk>.
1131    */
1132   protected final void returnStringBuilder(StringBuilder sb) {
1133      if (sb == null)
1134         return;
1135      sb.setLength(0);
1136      sbStack.push(sb);
1137   }

1149    *    after parsing is complete.
1150    */
1151   protected final boolean isAutoCloseStreams() {
1152      return ctx.isAutoCloseStreams();
1153   }

1161    */
1162   protected final int getDebugOutputLines() {

1224    *

1226    * @return
1227    *    Class used to listen for errors and warnings that occur during parsing.

1230      return ctx.getListener();

1233   @Override /* ContextSession */
1234   protected JsonMap properties() {
1235      return filteredMap("javaMethod", javaMethod, "listener", listener, "outer", outer);
1236   }
1237}
